imgh.py¶

Contains a number of helper functions for deaing with Image objects.

imgh.expr_as_latex(expr, substitutions)[source]¶

Converts a sympy expression in an image object into a latex expression. Subsitutions are made into the sympy object based on the substitutions dict passed to the function. The latex expression that is returned is of the specific form required by the Desmos API. This function can handle piecewise functions, points, as well as regular sympy expressions.

Parameters

  • expr (sympy) – A sympy object.

  • substitutions (dict) – A dictionary that associates sympy symbols in the expression with values. Note that the keys must be sympy objects.

Returns

A latex string of the original expression including the given substitutions.

Return type

str

imgh.get_expr_strs_as_sympy(img)[source]¶

Returns all expressions in an image storing expression strings as sympy objects. An expression is defined as either the entire expression string, or any substrings delimited by ‘{‘ and ‘}’. Note that this function does not mutate the img object.

Ex. identifies a in y = {a} * x + b

identifies the entire (y = a * x + b)

Parameters

img (image.Image) – An image object whose expressions are or include expression strings.

Returns

A list of sympy objects representing the expression strings in the original image.

Return type

list

imgh.piecewise_as_latex(expr, substitutions)[source]¶

Converts a sympy.Piecewise object in an image into a latex expression. Subsitutions are made into the sympy object based on the substitutions dict passed to the function. The latex expression that is returned is of the specific form required by the Desmos API.

Parameters

  • expr (sympy) – A sympy.Piecewise object.

  • substitutions (dict) – A dictionary that associates sympy symbols in the expression with values. Note that the keys must be sympy objects.

Returns

A latex string of the original expression including the given substitutions.

Return type

str

imgh.subs_latex(img, substitutions)[source]¶

Substitutes values from a dictionary into the latex strings stored in an image. Assumes the variables in the image’s expressions have been delimited with ‘@’ symbols. Should be called on an image object after as_latex() has been called.

Parameters

  • img (image.Image) – An image storing latex expressions.

  • substitutions (dict) – A dictionary that associates sympy symbols or strings in the expression with values.

Returns

A new image object with the given subsitutions applied to its expressions.

Return type

image.Image

imgh.subs_latex_expr(expr, substitutions)[source]¶

Substitutes values from a dictionary into a latex string.

Parameters

  • expr (string) – A latex string.

  • substitutions (dict) – A dictionary that associates sympy symbols or strings in the expression with values.

Returns

A latex string of the original expression including the given substitutions.

Return type

str

imgh.to_latex(img, vars=[])[source]¶

Returns an image with self.expressions as a list of latex strings. img stores sympy objects in self.expressions.

Some variables in the sympy object have not been replaced with values yet! For these variables, we delimit them by ‘@’ symbols which can be easily replaced later on (by a call to subs_latex).

Parameters

  • img (image.Image) – An image object containing sympy expressions.

  • vars (list, optional) – A list of variables in the sympy expression.

Returns

An image object whose expressions are latex strings.

Return type

image.Image

imgh.to_sympy(img)[source]¶

Returns a new image with self.expressions as a list of sympy objects. img stores expression strings strings in self.expressions. A sympy string is any string that can be evaluated to produce a sympy object or objects. To store multiple expressions in a sympy string, delimit them with ‘{‘ and ‘}’. Note that this function will not throw an error if the image’s expressions are already sympy objects.

Parameters

img (image.Image) – An image object whose expressions are expression strings.

Returns

An image object whose expressions are sympy objects.

Return type

image.Image
